coding_practice.title: Merge Sorted Array
coding_practice.description:
You are given two integer arrays nums1 and nums2, sorted in non-decreasing order, and two integers m and n, representing the number of elements in nums1 and nums2 respectively.

Merge nums1 and nums2 into a single array sorted in non-decreasing order.

The final sorted array should not be returned by the function, but instead be stored inside the array nums1. To accommodate this, nums1 has a length of m + n, where the first m elements denote the elements that should be merged, and the last n elements are set to 0 and should be ignored. nums2 has a length of n.

examples.explanation: The arrays we are merging are [1,2,3] and [2,5,6]. The result of the merge is [1,2,2,3,5,6] with the underlined elements coming from nums1.
The arrays we are merging are [1] and []. The result of the merge is [1].
The arrays we are merging are [] and [1]. The result of the merge is [1]. Note that because m = 0, there are no elements in nums1. The 0 is only there to ensure the merge result can fit in nums1.

coding_practice.constraints:
nums1.length == m + n
nums2.length == n
0 <= m, n <= 200
1 <= m + n <= 200
-10^9 <= nums1[i], nums2[j] <= 10^9
coding_practice.follow up: Can you come up with an algorithm that runs in O(m + n) time?
coding_practice.explanation: 使用三個指標 i, j, k 從尾部開始填寫 nums1，避免覆蓋未處理元素。比較 nums1[i] 和 nums2[j]，將較大值放到 nums1[k]。若 nums2 有剩餘元素，直接拷貝到 nums1 前面即可。
